page.title: 11Torweston Farm
page.content: The farm is a old one.It was built on the foundations of an{Elizabethan {castle.}The present farmhouse was built one hundred years ago in the Victorian times.The Victorians did many things.Once they built a{water {wheel}which could power the whole farm.It ran on two pools.The water went though under ground channels leading to the wheel. The owners of the farm are Mr and Mrs Richards.They own at the most twenty fields.Their boundary is the railway track.Some fields have names like the Great Big Field. At the farm they have an old {lime {kiln}which they used to put lime in and burn it. Then it would be taken to the fields and spread on the acid soil like fertilizer.
